intro: Matelea neei, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine hairs, and the stems are woody and branched. Matelea neei thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments.
